entry.title: è‹±è¯­å†™ä½œ - Spring Festival
entry.content:
ä»…ä¾›å‚è€ƒï¼Œè¯·å‹¿ç…§æ¬

Do you know what the Spring Festival is? Itâ€™s an traditional Chinese festival. We also call it Chinese New Year. Spring Festival falls on the first day of the first lunar month. ThroughoutÂ thousands of years of history, there have beenÂ many customs during the Spring Festival. Do you know any of them? Letâ€™s take a look!

New Yearâ€™sÂ Eve Customs

New Yearâ€™s EveÂ is a symbol of the end of the lunar year and the beginning of a new year. On this day, people always prepare to welcome the coming New Year, such as cleaning houses, preparing New Yearâ€™s goods, and setting offÂ firecrackers.

Moreover, the most important thing is having New Yearâ€™s Eve Dinner. Families see New Years Eve as a time to get together and usually celebrate with a big family meal. The main dish of this meal is almost always fish. This is because in Chinese, â€œfishâ€ is a symbol of â€œevery year, more and moreâ€.

New Yearâ€™s Greetings

On the morning of the Spring Festival, people get up early and wear new clothes. After that, people go out to visit friends and elders. Then, people greet them with â€œHappy New Yearâ€Â , â€œGood healthâ€Â or â€œLong lifeâ€. Nowadays, however, many people prefer to stay at home, so they usually send wishes to friends online.

Lucky Money

Lucky Money is also known as â€œhongbaoâ€. People put money in red envelopesÂ as a gift. And children usually get it from their family, as it is a symbol of long life and good luck.

All in all, the Spring Festival is an unforgettable memory and a beautiful picture of life. It is also a very important part of the Chinese culture. We should try to inherit it, shouldnâ€™t we?
